comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: The wonderfully-named Isambard Kingdom Brunel (1806-1859) was an English transportation engineer: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isambard_Kingdom_Brunel See that cigar in his mouth? Story has it that he smoked up to 40 cigars a day. (He died at 53.) John Scott Russell (1808-1882) was a Scottish naval engineer: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Scott_Russell The English photographer, Robert Howlett (1831-1858): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Howlett

comment.author: 24052676@N03
comment._content: Knew Brunel's Great-nephew Chris, and he looked like him...very strange how alike they were.

comment.author: 62760997@N05
comment._content: Isambard Kingdom Brunel is a hero of mine.  Incredibly inventive mind with examples everywhere of his work, specially in south western England.

comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: Assuming that this is indeed the 3 November 1857 launch, it's worth pointing out that it failed, as did a second attempt, but she was finally launched 31 January 1858. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Great_Eastern#Launch
